item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Niels Bohr
item.description: "An expert is a person who has made all the mistakes that can be made in a very narrow field." -- Niels Bohr

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I'm never going to accomplish anything; that's perfectly clear to me. I'm never going to be famous. My name will never be writ large on the roster of Those Who Do Things. I don't do anything. Not one single thing. I used to bite my nails, but I don't even do that any more." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "This is not a novel to be tossed aside lightly. It should be thrown with great force." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "If I didn't care for fun and such, I'd probably amount to much. But I shall stay the way I am, Because I do not give a damn." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Four be the things I'd have been better without: love, curiosity, freckles and doubt." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Richard Dawkins
item.description: "We are all atheists about most of the gods that humanity has ever believed in. Some of us just go one god further." -- Richard Dawkins

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Louisa May Alcott
item.description: "She is too fond of books, and it has turned her brain." -- Louisa May Alcott

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Jasper Fforde
item.description: "If the real world were a book, it would never find a publisher. Overlong, detailed to the point of distraction-and ultimately, without a major resolution." -- Jasper Fforde

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "18th century scientists, the French in particular, seldom did things simply if an absurdly demanding alternative was available." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Chelsea add a quote by Gordon B. Hinckley
item.description: "True love is not so much a matter of romance as it is a matter of anxious concern for the well-being of one's companion." -- Gordon B. Hinckley
